skills.name: Use direct proportion to solve unitary missing amounts in problems (e.g. recipes)
Use direct proportion to solve non-unitary missing amounts in problems (e.g. recipes)

explanations.A: This is the number of minutes it takes Max to write 1 word... The question is asking how many words can Max write in 1 minute?
explanations.B: There is a difference of 7 between 1 and 8 but to answer this question correctly, you need to think about what you multiply/ divide by to go from 8 to 1...
explanations.C: This is how many words Max can type in 64 minutes! You need to think about how you go from 8 minutes to 1 minute and apply this to 200...
explanations.D: If Max types 200 words in 8 minutes then to find how many words he types in 1 minute, we need to divide 200 by 8. 200 ÷ 8 = 25 therefore, Max can type 25 words in 1 minute!

explanations.A: This is how many words Kai can type in 16 minutes! You need to think about how you go from 4 minutes to 1 minute and apply this to 120...
explanations.B: If Kai types 120 words in 4 minutes then to find how many words he types in 1 minute, we need to divide 120 by 4. 120 ÷ 4 = 30 therefore, Kai can type 30 words in 1 minute!
explanations.C: This is the number of minutes it takes Kai to write 1 word... The question is asking how many words can Kai write in 1 minute?
explanations.D: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. What do you divide 4 by to get 1? Do the same to the number of words...

explanations.A: You have accidentally divided the wrong way round and have found how much clip Lucy gets per dollar but the question wants how many dollars per clip...
explanations.B: There is a difference of 5 between 1 and 6 but to answer this question correctly, you need to think about what you multiply/ divide by to go from 6 to 1...
explanations.C: I think you have correctly worked out that 15 ÷ 6 = 2.5 but have struggled to convert this decimal into dollars. Double check what place value column the 5 is in, it's not 2.05 which would be $2.05, what is it?
explanations.D: If Lucy bought 6 hair clips for $15 then to find the cost of one hair clip we do 15 ÷ 6 = 2.5. Therefore, one hair clip costs $2.50!

explanations.A: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. What do you divide 5 by to get 1? Do the same to the cost of the pens to find out how much one pen is...
explanations.B: If Adam bought 5 pens for $21 then to find the cost of one pen we do 21 ÷ 5 = 4.2. Therefore, one pen costs $4.20!
explanations.C: You have accidentally divided the wrong way round and have found how much pen Adam gets per dollar but the question wants how many dollars per pen...
explanations.D: I think you have correctly worked out that 21 ÷ 5 = 4.2 but have struggled to convert this decimal into dollars. Double check what place value column the 2 is in, it's not 4.02 which would be $4.02, what is it?

explanations.A: This is how long it would take Joe to make one crust but the question is asking how long it takes him to make 5 crusts!
explanations.B: There is a difference of 32 between 8 and 40 but to answer this question correctly, you need to think about what you multiply or divide by to go from 40 to 8...
explanations.C: If Joe can make 8 crusts in 40 minutes, he can make 1 crust in 5 minutes because 40 ÷ 8 = 5. We want to know the time it takes him to make 5 crusts so we do 5 x 5 minutes = 25 minutes!
explanations.D: You are correct that you need to start by dividing and then multiply. But, if 8 pizza crusts takes 40 minutes, what should you divide by to get the time taken for 1 crust?

explanations.A: If Ellie can make 9 plates in 54 minutes, she can make 1 plate in 6 minutes because 54 ÷ 9 = 6. We want to know the time it takes her to make 2 plates so we do 2 x 6 minutes = 12 minutes!
explanations.B: This is how long it would take Ellie to make one plate, but the question is asking how long it takes her to make 2 plates!
explanations.C: You are correct that you need to start by dividing and then multiply. But, if 9 plates takes 54 minutes, what should you divide by to get the time taken for 1 plate?
explanations.D: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. If 9 plates takes 54 minutes, what should you divide 54 by to get the time taken for 1 plate?

explanations.A: If a camp uses 3 counselors for 12 campers then it will use 1 counselor for 4 campers. If there are 64 campers, 4 x 16 = 64 therefore, 16 counselors will be needed!
explanations.B: You have started your calculation correctly but you cannot round the 5.333333333... up to 6, you need to keep the answer as it is!
explanations.C: Start by finding the number of campers per one counselor and then multiply this value up to get the number of counselors for 64 campers!
explanations.D: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. What do you multiply 3 by to get 12? Do the reverse to go from 64 to the number of counselors needed...

explanations.A: You have started your calculation correctly but you cannot round the 3.25... up to 4, you need to keep the answer as it is!
explanations.B: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. What do you multiply 4 by to get 24? Do the reverse to go from 78 to the number of counselors needed...
explanations.C: If a camp uses 4 counselors for 24 campers then it will use 1 counselor for 6 campers. If there are 78 campers, 6 x 13 = 78 therefore, 13 counselors will be needed!
explanations.D: Start by finding the number of campers per one counselor and then multiply this value up to get the number of counselors for 78 campers!

explanations.A: I think you have mixed up the values, 2 cups of flour makes 12 muffins... Can you use this to work out how many cups are needed to make 18 muffins?
explanations.B: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. 2 cups of flour is used to make 12 muffins, how many times more is 18 muffins? Apply this value to the cups of flour...
explanations.C: To go from 12 to 18 you multiply by 1.5 so this is the scale factor. If 2 cups of flour are used for 12 muffins to find the cups of flour for 18 we do 1.5 x 2 = 3 therefore, 3 cups of flour are needed to make 18 muffins!
explanations.D: This is the correct scale factor, but now you need to apply it to the cups of flour...

explanations.A: This is the correct scale factor but now you need to apply it to the cups of sugar...
explanations.B: I think you have mixed up the values, 2 cups of sugar makes 16 cookies... Can you use this to work out how many cups are needed to make 40 cookies?
explanations.C: These values have a multiplicative relationship, not additive. 2 cups of sugar is used to make 16 cookies, how many times more is 40 cookies? Apply this value to the cups of sugar...
explanations.D: To go from 16 to 40 you multiply by 2.5 so this is the scale factor. If 2 cups of sugar are used for 16 cookies to find the cups of sugar for 40 we do 2.5 x 2 = 5 therefore, 5 cups of sugar are needed to make 40 cookies!
